name: Lachnantes
Relationship: Compare: DULC.; BRY.; PULS.; also FEL TAURI (nape of neck pains, and great tension there).

Head: Circumscribed red cheeks; scalp feels sore, as if hair was standing on end; burning in palms and soles
Scalp painful
Sleepless
Right-sided pain, extending down to jaw; HEAD FEELS ENLARGED; worse, least noise
Bridge of nose feels as if pinched
Chest: Sensation of heat - bubbling and boiling around heart region rising to head
Pain in nape, as if dislocated
DRAWN OVER TO ONE SIDE in sore throat
CHILLINESS BETWEEN THE SHOULDER-BLADES; pain and stiffness in back
Skin: Body icy cold; face yellow, tendency to sweat

details: Head, chest and circulation are affected. Bridge of nose as if pinched. A remedy for torticollis, rheumatic symptoms about neck. TUBERCULOSIS - light-complexioned people. Early stages, and established chest cases, with much coldness. Produces a desire to talk - a flow of language and the courage to make a speech.
dosage: Third potency. Tincture in phthisis, unit doses, once or twice a week, or three drops every four hours.
